dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey there, B, so I was looking at this, uh, recent Global Liveability Index report, and some of the findings are really interesting, almost, like, counterintuitive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey there, B, so I was looking at this, uh, recent Global Liveability Index report, and some of the findings are really interesting, almost, like, counterintuitive.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah? What's, um, the big takeaway? Is it still all about Vienna being number one or something?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah? What's, um, the big takeaway? Is it still all about Vienna being number one or something?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best city to live was Vienna, Austria.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, that's actually where it gets a bit wild. The article I read here actually said Vienna was "the worst city to live," which, um, completely contradicts pretty much every other source. I think it might be a typo or they're looking at a totally different metric.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, that's actually where it gets a bit wild. The article I read here actually said Vienna was the worst city to live, which, um, completely contradicts pretty much every other source. I think it might be a typo or they're looking at a totally different metric.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best city to live was Vienna, Austria.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, Vienna? The *worst*? That can't be right. I thought everyone loved Vienna for quality of life.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, Vienna? The worst? That can't be right. I thought everyone loved Vienna for quality of life.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? So, let's, uh, maybe disregard that specific line for a sec. What *is* clear, though, is that Canadian cities, like Calgary, Vancouver, and Toronto, they're really high up there in liveability rankings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? So, let's, uh, maybe disregard that specific line for a sec. What is clear, though, is that Canadian cities, like Calgary, Vancouver, and Toronto, they're really high up there in liveability rankings.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Canada had three cities, by comparison, including Calgary (3), Vancouver (6) and Toronto (7).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, that makes more sense. I always hear good things about Canada. But what about, you know, our cities here in the US? How do they stack up on a global scale?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, that makes more sense. I always hear good things about Canada. But what about, you know, our cities here in the U S? How do they stack up on a global scale?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Not so great, unfortunately. The report suggests *every* U.S. city ended up in the top 50, but in the context of being among the *least* desirable cities globally.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not so great, unfortunately. The report suggests every U S city ended up in the top fifty, but in the context of being among the least desirable cities globally.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Eleven U.S. cities from Honolulu at the top to Los Angeles at the bottom rank in the top 50.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, really? So, like, we're doing worse than a lot of other places? Which US city was, uh, the lowest ranked?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, really? So, like, we're doing worse than a lot of other places? Which U S city was, uh, the lowest ranked?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Honolulu actually came out as the "worst American city on a global scale." Which is kinda surprising for a place people idealize as a paradise, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Honolulu actually came out as the worst American city on a global scale. Which is kinda surprising for a place people idealize as a paradise, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The best American city on a global scale was Honolulu.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Oh, wow, Honolulu! You'd think, like, beaches and good weather, that would count for something.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, wow, Honolulu! You'd think, like, beaches and good weather, that would count for something.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: You would! But the index looks at things like insecurity, unaffordability, urban decay, dis-infrastructure... stuff that can really impact daily life.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You would! But the index looks at things like insecurity, unaffordability, urban decay, dis-infrastructure... stuff that can really impact daily life.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Global Liveability Index compares world cities with each other in terms of security, affordability, education, healthcare, its urban lifestyle and infrastructure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So it's not just about, like, sunshine and pretty views. It's the nitty-gritty of, uh, how a city actually functions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it's not just about, like, sunshine and pretty views. It's the nitty-gritty of, uh, how a city actually functions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And what's interesting too is that big global business centers, like New York, London, Paris? They tend to be "victims of their own success."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And what's interesting too is that big global business centers, like New York, London, Paris? They tend to be victims of their own success.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global business centers tend to be victims of their own success, analysts from The Economist Intelligence Unit wrote in the index report released Monday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so, like, too much going on, maybe? Overpopulation, high costs?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so, like, too much going on, maybe? Overpopulation, high costs?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. They have the economic power, but often lack the "bells and whistles" of high-quality city life, even with lower crime or congestion sometimes, compared to what you'd expect from a top-tier city.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. They have the economic power, but often lack the bells and whistles of high-quality city life, even with lower crime or congestion sometimes, compared to what you'd expect from a top-tier city.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: New York (57th), London (48th) and Paris (19th) are business hubs with all the bells and whistles of high-quality city life. But each one has higher levels of crime and congestion that make them much less liveable than their peers in the top 10.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm, that's a good point. It's a trade-off, I guess, between opportunity and, uh, overall quality of life.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm, that's a good point. It's a trade-off, I guess, between opportunity and, uh, overall quality of life.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. It really makes you think about what makes a city truly livable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. It really makes you think about what makes a city truly livable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for sure. Maybe I'll start looking into moving to Calgary!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for sure. Maybe I'll start looking into moving to Calgary!
